column4: I've lost my CD drive!  Can't make it work...  I think it's my 2nd HD that took over, can anyone help?
try `dmesg | egrep "^hd"`
provided they are IDE drives
yes they are
what happened in you situation?
your*

My CD drive used to work, but when I booted earlier, it said that I mount 30 times my "windows HD" and I needed to fdisk or something (some kind of scan) and I think it messed up my drives and the way they were mounted!
fsck shouldn't mess up your partitions like that.. can you get to a working system on that machine, or where does it get stuck at?
I'm on that exact machine, and all my drives are working except for the CD!
When I try to click on my CD it says "unable to mount selected volume" and in details it says " special device /dev/hdc/ does not exist"
what happens when you type in "dmesg | egrep 'hdc' " in a terminal?
[17179576.528000]      ide1: BM-DMA at 0xf008-0xf00f, BIOS settings: hdc:DMA, hdd:DMA
what does it give if you do `ls -l /dev/hd* `
trying to put it on pastebin...  but pastebin is giving me a hard time
try rafb.net
http://rafb.net/p/3gopOi11.html
how many IDE hard drives do you have?
I have 2 hard drives
that shows that you have 2 detected, hda and hdb
weird.. no cdrom! ;)
It is weird...  kind off the reason I'm here asking for your sweet help!!  hehehe
is it detected in bios?
that would help, make sure you can still boot from it to be sure it isn't the drive itself
I'll check that out...  brb
